trans-unit.source: Defines values for specifying how the heights of rows are adjusted.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control can resize its rows based on the preferred height of each row.
The preferred row height is the minimum height required to display the largest cell value in that row.

Different size modes let you indicate which cells are used to calculate the new heights (either header cells or nonheader cells) and whether to resize all rows or only the rows that are currently displayed.
Resizing a subset of rows is useful to avoid a performance penalty when working with many rows of data.
Content-based automatic resizing prevents users from adjusting row heights with the mouse.

This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AutoSizeRowsMode%2A> property and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AutoResizeRows%2A> method.
For more information about sizing modes, see [Sizing Options in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of all cells in the rows, including header cells.
To be added.
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of all cells in the rows, excluding header cells.
To be added.
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of the row header.
To be added.
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of all cells in rows currently displayed onscreen, including header cells.
To be added.
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of all cells in rows currently displayed onscreen, excluding header cells.
To be added.
The row heights adjust to fit the contents of the row headers currently displayed onscreen.
To be added.
The row heights do not automatically adjust.
To be added.
